intro: Megalastrum indusiatum, commonly known as the Indian star anise, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in dense forests. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their strong flavor and essential oils. The botanical features of Megalastrum indusiatum make it an important species in both ecological and commercial contexts.
